sen.j: 鷹狩（たかがり）とは、鷹などの鳥を使った狩猟の一種。
sen.e: "Taka-gari (falconry)" is a kind of hunting which uses birds such as falconine.
"Taka-gari (falconry)" is a kind of hunting which uses a falcon.
Taka-gari (falconry) is a kind of hunting which uses a falcon.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』がないので" "を削除

sen.j: タカ科のオオタカ、ハイタカ、及びハヤブサ科のハヤブサ等を訓練し、鳥類やウサギなどの小動物を捕らえさせ、餌とすりかえる。
sen.e: It educates goshawk or sparrow hawk of Accipitridae or falcon of Falconidae to capture small animals such as birds and rabbit, which are changed to feed.
Goshawk, or sparrow hawk, or falcon are trained to capture small animals such as birds and rabbits, which are changed to feed.
Goshawk, or sparrow hawk of Accipitridae, or falcon of Falconidae are trained to capture small animals such as birds and rabbit, which are changed to feed.
sen.cmt: wordinessとありますが、原文の通りの原則で「タカ科」「ハヤブサ科」補足。

sen.j: あるじの元に運んでくるというのは俗信である。
sen.e: It is a vulgar superstition that falconine brings preyto its owner.
There is a vulgar superstition that falcons bring preyto its owner.
There is a vulgar superstition that falcons bring preyto its owner.

sen.j: こうして鷹を扱う人間は、鷹匠（たかじょう）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: A person who treats falconine is called Takajo astringer.
A person who practices falconry is called Takajo astringer.
A person who practices falconry is called Takajo astringer.

sen.j: 古語においては鳥狩/鷹田（とがり）、放鷹、鷹野などとも称する。
sen.e: In ancient words it is also called Togari, falconry and Takano.
In ancient words it is also called Togari, falconry, and Takano.
In ancient words it is also called Togari, falconry, and Takano.

sen.j: 中央アジアないしモンゴル高原起源と考えられているが、発祥地と年代について定説はない。
sen.e: It is thought to originate from Central Asia or Mongolian plateau, but there is no established theory on its birthplace and date.
It is thought to originate from Central Asia or the Mongolian plateau, but there is no established theory on its birthplace and date.
It is thought to originate from Central Asia or the Mongolian plateau, but there is no established theory on its birthplace and date.

sen.j: 近代以前は、東は日本、西はアイルランド、モロッコ、北はモンゴル、スカンディナヴィア、南はインドに至るユーラシア/北アフリカ全域で各地方独特の鷹狩文化が開花した。
sen.e: Before modern age, each original Taka-gari culture flowered in all area of Eurasia and North Africa from Japan in the eastern area to Ireland and Morocco in the western area, and Mongolia and Scandinavia in the northern area and India in the southern area.

Before modern times, original Taka-gari cultures flowered all over Eurasia and North Africa from Japan in the east to Ireland and Morocco in the west, and Mongolia and Scandinavia in the north and India in the south.

Before modern times, original Taka-gari cultures flowered all over Eurasia and North Africa from Japan in the east to Ireland and Morocco in the west, and Mongolia and Scandinavia in the north and India in the south.

sen.j: 現代では、かつて盛行したインドやイランで絶滅しかけている反面、南北アメリカ及び南アフリカでも行われている。
sen.e: Today, while it is nearly to be disappeared in India and Iran where it was popular once, it is performed in Ameriacas and South Africa as well.
Today, while it has nearly disappeared in India and Iran where it was once popular, it is still practiced in the Americas and South Africa as well.
Today, while it has nearly disappeared in India and Iran where it was once popular, it is still practiced in the Americas and South Africa as well.

sen.j: 日本では支配者の狩猟活動は権威の象徴的な意味を持ち、古墳時代の埴輪には手に鷹を乗せたものも存在する。
sen.e: In Japan, hunting by rulers implied symbolic sense of authority and some clay figures in Kofun Period put on falconine on the hand.
In Japan, hunting by rulers implied a symbolic sense of authority and some clay figures in Kofun Period display a falcon on their arms.
In Japan, hunting by rulers implied a symbolic sense of authority and some clay figures in Kofun Period display a falcon on their arms.

sen.j: 日本書紀には仁徳天皇の時代（仁徳紀43年）には鷹狩が行われ、タカを調教する鷹甘部（たかかいべ：鷹飼部）が置かれたという記録がある。
sen.e: In Chronicles of Japan, there is a description that Taka-gari was performed in the era of Emperor Nintoku (Nintoku 43) and Takakai-be who educated falconine was appointed.
In the Chronicles of Japan, there is a description explaining that Taka-gari was practiced in the era of Emperor Nintoku (Nintoku 43) and Takakai-be who trained falcons, was appointed.
In the Chronicles of Japan, there is a description explaining that Taka-gari was practiced in the era of Emperor Nintoku (Nintoku 43) and Takakai-be who trained falcons, was appointed.

sen.j: 古代には鷹場が禁野として一般の出入りが制限され、天皇の鷹狩をつかさどる放鷹司（大宝令）/主鷹司（養老令）が置かれた。
sen.e: In ancient times the place for falconry was limited as Kinya (hunting ground for the Emperor where is banned to hunt by public people), and hoyoshi (by Taiho Code) and Shuyoshi (by Yoro-rei Act) who conducted Taka-gari of Emperor were appointed.

In ancient times areas where falconry was practiced was limited as Kinya (hunting grounds for the Emperor where the public was banned from hunting), and hoyoshi (by Taiho Code) and Shuyoshi (by Yoro-rei Act) who conducted Taka-gari for Emperor were appointed.

In ancient times areas where falconry was practiced was limited as Kinya (hunting grounds for the Emperor where the public was banned from hunting), and hoyoshi (by Taiho Code) and Shuyoshi (by Yoro-rei Act) who conducted Taka-gari for Emperor were appointed.

sen.j: 正倉院に放鷹司関係文書が残っており、長屋王邸跡から鷹狩に関連する木簡が出土している。
sen.e: Documents related to hoyoshi remain at Shosoin and wood strips related to Taka-gari were excavated from the site of Nagayao's residence.
Documents related to hoyoshi remain at Shosoin and wood strips related to Taka-gari were excavated from the site of Nagayao's residence.
Documents related to hoyoshi remain at Shoso-in Treasure Repository and wood strips related to Taka-gari were excavated from the site of Nagayao's residence.

sen.j: 平安時代には主鷹司が廃止され、蔵人所が鷹狩を管掌する。
sen.e: In Heian Period Shuyoshi was abolished and Kurodo-dokoro government organization was in charge of Taka-gari.
In Heian Period Shuyoshi was abolished and Kurodo-dokoro government organization was in charge of Taka-gari.
In Heian Period Shuyoshi was abolished and Kurodo-dokoro government organization was in charge of Taka-gari.

sen.j: 奈良時代の愛好者としては大伴家持が知られる。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yakamochi is known as a devotee during Nara Period.
OTOMO no Yakamochi is known as a devotee during Nara Period.
OTOMO no Yakamochi is known as a devotee during the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: Nara Perio→the Nara Periodに変更しました。

sen.j: 平安時代においては、初期の桓武天皇、嵯峨天皇、光孝天皇、宇多天皇、醍醐天皇らとその子孫は鷹狩を好んだ。
sen.e: In the early Heian Period, Emperor Kammu, Emperor Saga, Emperor Koko, Emperor Uda, Emperor Daigo and their descendants favored Taka-gari.
In the early Heian Period, Emperor Kammu, Emperor Saga, Emperor Koko, Emperor Uda, Emperor Daigo, and their descendants favored Taka-gari.
In the early Heian Period, Emperor Kanmu, Emperor Saga, Emperor Koko, Emperor Uda, Emperor Daigo, and their descendants favored Taka-gari.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇は鷹狩に関する漢詩を残しているほか、技術書として「新修鷹経」を編纂させている(818年)。
sen.e: Emperor Saga wrote Chinese-style poem on Taka-gari and made 'Shinshu-yokyo' edited as a technique book for falconry (818).
Emperor Saga wrote Chinese-style poems on Taka-gari and wrote 'Shinshu-yokyo' edited as a book of techniques for falconry (818).
Emperor Saga wrote Chinese-style poems on Taka-gari and wrote 'Shinshu-yokyo' edited as a book of techniques for falconry (818).

sen.j: 現存する鷹狩技術のテキストとしては世界で二番目に古い。
sen.e: It is the second oldest among existing technique books for falconry.
It is the second oldest among existing books on falconry technique..
It is the second oldest among existing books on falconry technique..

sen.j: 中期以降においても、一条天皇、白河天皇などの愛好者が現れたが、天皇自身よりも貴族層による鷹狩が主流となる。
sen.e: After the mid-Heian Period, Emperor Ichijo and Emperor Shirakawa favored Taka-gari, but it was mainly performed by aristocrats rather than Emperors.
After the mid-Heian Period, Emperor Ichijo and Emperor Shirakawa favored Taka-gari, but it was mainly practiced by aristocrats rather than Emperors.
After the mid-Heian Period, Emperor Ichijo and Emperor Shirakawa favored Taka-gari, but it was mainly practiced by aristocrats rather than Emperors.

sen.j: 坂上田村麻呂、在原行平、在原業平は鷹狩の名手としても知られた。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, ARIWARA no Yukihira and ARIWARA no Narihira were known as past masters atTaka-gari as well.
SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, ARIWARA no Yukihira, and ARIWARA no Narihira, were known as past masters ofTaka-gari as well.
SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, ARIWARA no Yukihira, and ARIWARA no Narihira, were known as past masters ofTaka-gari as well.

sen.j: 鷹狩は文学の題材ともなり、伊勢物語、源氏物語、今昔物語等に鷹狩にまつわるエピソードがある。
sen.e: Taka-gari was also a subject of literature such as The Tale of Ise, The Tale of Genji and Konjaku Monogatari (Tales of Times Now Past), in which there are some episodes related to Taka-gari.
Taka-gari was also the subject of literature such as The Tale of Ise, The Tale of Genji, and Konjaku Monogatari, (Tales of Times Now Past), in which there are some episodes related to Taka-gari.
Taka-gari was also the subject of literature such as The Tale of Ise, The Tale of Genji, and Konjaku Monogatari (Tales of Times Now Past), in which there are some episodes related to Taka-gari.

sen.j: 和歌の世界においては、鷹狩は「大鷹狩」と「小鷹狩」に分けられ、中世にいたるまで歌題の一つであった。
sen.e: In the world of Waka/Yamatouta Japanese poem, Taka-gari had been a subject until medieval times, divided into 'Otakagari' and 'Kotakagari.'
In the world of Waka/Yamatouta Japanese poems, Taka-gari has been a subject divided into 'Otakagari' and 'Kotakagari.' until medieval times.
sen.cmt: punctuation, restructed for clarity and correctness
sen.e: In the world of Waka/Yamatouta Japanese poems, Taka-gari has been a subject divided into 'Otakagari' and 'Kotakagari' until medieval times.

sen.j: 「大鷹狩」は冬の歌語であり、「小鷹狩」は秋の歌語である。
sen.e: Otakagari' is winter's Kago (words and expressions for Waka) and 'Kotakagari' is autum's Kago.
Otakagari' is winter Kago (words and expressions for Waka) and 'Kotakagari' is autum Kago.
Otakagari' is winter Kago (words and expressions for Waka) and 'Kotakagari' is autumn Kago.

sen.j: 中世には武家の間でも行われ始め、一遍上人絵伝や聖衆来迎寺六道絵の描写や吾妻鏡・曾我物語の記述に鎌倉時代の有様をうかがうことができる。
sen.e: In medieval times, Taka-gari began to be performed among warriors and we can see how it was done in Kamakura Period by descriptions in Ippenshonin-eden picture scroll, Rokudo-e (painting of the six realms) of Shoju-raigo-ji Temple, Azuma-kagami (history book) and Soga-monogatari military epic.

In medieval times, Taka-gari started to be practiced among warriors and we can see how it was done in the Kamakura Period from descriptions on the Ippenshonin-eden picture scroll, Rokudo-e (painting of the six realms) of Shoju-raigo-ji Temple, Azuma-kagami (history book) and Soga-monogatari military epic.

In medieval times, Taka-gari started to be practiced among warriors and we can see how it was done in the Kamakura Period from descriptions on the Ippenshonin-eden picture scroll, Rokudo-e (painting of the six realms) of Shoju-raigo-ji Temple, Azuma-kagami (history book) and Soga-monogatari military epic.

sen.j: 室町時代の様子は洛中洛外図屏風各本に描かれている。
sen.e: The atmosphere of Taka-gari in Muromachi Period can be seen in each byobu folding screen with paintings of inside and outside Kyo capital.
The atmosphere of Taka-gari in the Muromachi Period can be seen in each byobu folding screen with paintings both inside and outside the Kyo capital.
The atmosphere of Taka-gari in the Muromachi Period can be seen in each byobu folding screen with paintings both inside and outside the Kyo capital.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代には織田信長が大の鷹好きとして知られる。
sen.e: In Azuchi-momoyama Period, Nobunaga ODA is known as a devotee of falconry
In Azuchi-momoyama Period, Nobunaga ODA is known as a devotee of falconry
In Azuchi-Momoyama Period, Nobunaga ODA is known as a devotee of falconry.

sen.j: 東山 (京都府)で鷹狩を行ったこと、諸国の武将がこぞって信長に鷹を献上したことが『信長公記』に記載されている。
sen.e: In "Nobunaga-koki (biography of Nobunaga ODA)" there is a description that he performed Taka-gari in Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) and that warlords from various provinces completed to present falconine to Nobunaga.

In "Nobunaga-koki (biography of Nobunaga ODA)" there is a description of him practicing Taka-gari in Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) and that warlords from various provinces competed to present falcons to Nobunaga.

In "Nobunaga-koki (biography of Nobunaga ODA)" there is a description of him practicing Taka-gari in Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) and that warlords from various provinces competed to present falcons to Nobunaga.

sen.j: また、朝倉宗滴（宗滴）は、オオタカの飼育下繁殖に成功しており、現在判明している限りでは世界最古の成功記録である。
sen.e: In addition, Soteki ASAKURA succeeded captive breeding of goshawk, which is the oldest record in the world as far as known at present.
In addition, Soteki ASAKURA succeeded in the captive breeding of goshawk, which is the oldest record in the world as far as known at present.
In addition, Soteki ASAKURA succeeded in the captive breeding of goshawk, which is the oldest record in the world as far as known at present.

sen.j: 公家及び公家随身による鷹狩も徳川家康による禁止まで引き続き行われ、公卿の持明院家、西園寺家、地下の下毛野家などが鷹狩を家業とし、和歌あるいは散文形式の技術書（「鷹書」）が著されている。
sen.e: Taka-gari by court noble and its attendants had been also performed until it was forbidden by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and Jimyoin family and Saionji family of noble and Shimotsuke family of Jige (officer not allowed to enter the Imperial palace) had made Taka-gari their family business and wrote a technique book ('book of falconry') on Waka style or prose style.

Taka-gari by court noble and its attendants had been also performed until it was forbidden by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and Jimyoin family and Saionji family of noble and Shimotsuke family of Jige (officer not allowed to enter the Imperial palace) had made Taka-gari their family business and wrote a technique book ('book of falconry') on Waka style or prose style.

Taka-gari by court noble and its attendants had been also performed until it was forbidden by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and Jimyoin family and Saionji family of noble and Shimotsuke family of Jige (officer not allowed to enter the Imperial palace) had made Taka-gari their family business and wrote a technique book ('book of falconry') on Waka style or prose style.

sen.j: 近衛前久は鷹狩の権威者として織田信長と交わり、また豊臣秀吉と徳川家康に解説書「龍山公鷹百首」を与えている。
sen.e: Sakihisa KONOE communicated with Nobunaga ODA as an authority of Taka-gari and gave a practical guide, 'Ryuzan-ko Taka-hyakushu' to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA as well.
Sakihisa KONOE communicated with Nobunaga ODA as an authority of Taka-gari and gave a practical guide, 'Ryuzan-ko Taka-hyakushu' to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA as well.
Sakihisa KONOE communicated with Nobunaga ODA as an authority of Taka-gari and gave a practical guide, 'Ryuzan-ko Taka-hyakushu' to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA as well.

sen.j: 一方、武家においても、諏訪大社や二荒山神社への贄鷹儀礼と結びついて、禰津流、小笠原流、宇都宮流等の鷹術流派が現れ、禰津信直門下からは、屋代流、荒井流、吉田流などが分派した。
sen.e: On the other hand, in warrior class Taka-gari developed combined with ceremony to sacrifice a hawk in Suwa Taisha and Futarasan-jinja Shrine, and led to the schools of falconry technique such as Nezu-ryu school, Ogasawara-ryu school and Utsunomiya-ryu school, and moreover, Yashiro-ryu school, Arai-ryu school and Yoshida-ryu school split from descendant of Nobunao NEZU.

On the other hand, in the warrior class Taka-gari developed in combination with a ceremony to sacrifice a hawk in Suwa Taisha and Futarasan-jinja Shrines, and that led to the schools of falconry technique such as the Nezu-ryu school, the Ogasawara-ryu school, and Utsunomiya-ryu school, and moreover, the Yashiro-ryu school, the Arai-ryu school, and Yoshida-ryu school, split from descendant of Nobunao NEZU.

On the other hand, in the warrior class Taka-gari developed in combination with a ceremony to sacrifice a hawk in Suwa Taisha and Futarasan-jinja Shrines, and that led to the schools of falconry technique such as the Nezu school, the Ogasawara school, and Utsunomiya school, and moreover, the Yashiro school, the Arai school, and Yoshida school, split from descendant of Nobunao NEZU.

sen.j: 戦国武将の間で鷹狩が広まったが、特に徳川家康が鷹狩を好んだのは有名である。
sen.e: Taka-gari spread among busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period, among whom especially Ieyasu TOKUGAWA is famous for a devotee of Taka-gari.
Taka-gari spread among busho (Japanese military commanders) in the Sengoku Period, among whom especially Ieyasu TOKUGAWA is famous as a devotee of Taka-gari.
Taka-gari spread among busho (Japanese military commanders) in the Sengoku Period, among whom especially Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was famous as a devotee of Taka-gari.
sen.cmt: 歴史上のことなので過去形にしました。

sen.j: 家康には鷹匠組なる技術者が側近として付いていた。
sen.e: Ieyasu appointed Takajo-gumi, astringers, that is, technicians of Taka-gari, and put them as his asides.
Ieyasu appointed Takajo-gumi, astringers, that is, technicians of Taka-gari, and assigned them as his aides.
Ieyasu appointed Takajo-gumi, astringers, that is, technicians of Taka-gari, and assigned them as his aides.

sen.j: 鷹匠組頭に伊部勘右衛門という人が大御所時代までいた。
sen.e: Kanemon IMBE had served Ieyashu as a head of Takajo-gumi, astringers, even after Ieyasu retired Shogun.
Kanemon IMBE had served Ieyasu as a head of Takajo-gumi, astringers, even after Ieyasu retired as Shogun.
Kanemon IMBE had served Ieyasu as a head of Takajo-gumi, astringers, even after Ieyasu retired as Shogun.

sen.j: 東照宮御影として知られる家康の礼拝用肖像画にも白鷹が書き込まれる場合が多い。
sen.e: On the Ieyasu's portraits for prayer, which are known as Toshogu-Mikage (image of Toshogu, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), white hawk is often drawn.
On the Ieyasu's portraits for prayer, which are known as Toshogu-Mikage (image of Toshogu, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), a white hawk is often drawn.
On the Ieyasu's portraits for prayer, which are known as Toshogu-Mikage (image of Toshogu, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), a white hawk is often drawn.

sen.j: 江戸時代には代々の徳川将軍は鷹狩を好んだ。
sen.e: In Edo Period successive Tokugawa Shogun favored Taka-gari.
In the Edo Period successive Tokugawa Shogun favored Taka-gari.
In the Edo Period successive Tokugawa Shogun favored Taka-gari.

sen.j: 三代将軍徳川家光は特に好み、将軍在位中に数百回も鷹狩を行った。
sen.e: Especially, the third Shogun, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, favored it very much and performed Taka-gari hundreds times during his reign as Shogun.
Especially, the third Shogun, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, favored it very much and practiced Taka-gari hundreds times during his reign as Shogun.
Especially, the third Shogun, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, favored it very much and practiced Taka-gari hundreds times during his reign as Shogun.

sen.j: 家光は将軍専用の鷹場を整備して鳥見を設置したり、江戸城二の丸に鷹を飼う「鷹坊」を設置したことで知られている。
sen.e: Iemitsu is known to have made a place for falconry for exclusive use of Shogun, appointed Torimi (officer for falconry) and built Takabo (鷹坊) to feed falconine at Ninomaru (outer citadel) of Edo Castle.

Iemitsu is known to have made a place for falconry for the exclusive use of Shogun, appointed Torimi (officer for falconry) and built Takabo (鷹坊) to feed falcons at Ninomaru (the outer citadel) of Edo Castle.

Iemitsu is known to have made a place for falconry for the exclusive use of Shogun, appointed Torimi (officer for falconry) and built 'Takabo (鷹坊)' to feed falcons at Ninomaru (the outer citadel) of Edo Castle.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ'を補足

sen.j: 家光時代の鷹狩については江戸図屏風でその様子をうかがうことができる。
sen.e: The atmosphere of Taka-gari in the era of Iemitsu can be seen in Edo-zu Byobu (folding screen with Edo-zu paintings).
The atmosphere of Taka-gari in the era of Iemitsu can be seen in the Edo-zu Byobu (folding screen with Edo-zu paintings).
The atmosphere of Taka-gari in the era of Iemitsu can be seen in the Edo-zu Byobu (folding screen with Edo-zu paintings).

sen.j: 五代将軍徳川綱吉は動物愛護の法令である「生類憐れみの令」によって鷹狩を段階的に廃止したが、八代将軍徳川吉宗の時代に復活した。
sen.e: The fifth Shogun, Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, abolished Taka-gari step-by-step by 'Shorui-Awaremi-no-rei,' ordinances of animal protection, but it was revived in the era of the eighth Shogun, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.

The fifth Shogun, Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, abolished Taka-gari, step-by-step, by 'Shorui-Awaremi-no-rei,' ordinances for animal protection, but it was revived in the era of the eighth Shogun, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.

The fifth Shogun, Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, abolished Taka-gari, step-by-step, by 'Shorui-Awaremi-no-rei,' ordinances for animal protection, but it was revived in the era of the eighth Shogun, Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 徳川吉宗は古今の鷹書を収集・研究し、自らも鶴狩の著作を残している。
sen.e: Yoshimune TOKUGAWA collected and researched ancient and modern books of falconry and wrote books of hunting crane by himself.
Yoshimune TOKUGAWA collected and researched ancient and modern books on falconry and wrote books about hunting crane by himself.
Yoshimune TOKUGAWA collected and researched ancient and modern books on falconry and wrote books about hunting crane by himself.

sen.j: 累代の江戸幕府の鷹書は内閣文庫等に収蔵されている。
sen.e: The successive books of falconry in Edo Shogunate are in the possession of Naikaku-bunko book stock and so on.
Successive books on falconry during the Edo Shogunate are in the possession of the Naikaku-bunko book stock, etc.
Successive books on falconry during the Edo Shogunate are in the possession of the Naikaku-bunko book stock, etc.

sen.j: 江戸時代の大名では、伊達重村、島津重豪、松平斉貴などが鷹狩愛好家として特に著名であり、特に松平斉貴が研究用に収集した文献は、今日東京国立博物館や島根県立図書館等に収蔵されている。
sen.e: Among daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) Shigemura DATE, Shigehide SHIMAZU and Naritoki MATSUDAIRA are famous as devotees of Taka-gari and especially the books which Naritoki MATSUDAIRA collected for research are housed in Tokyo National Museum, Shimane prefectural library and so on.

Among daimyo (Japanese territorial lords) Shigemura DATE, Shigehide SHIMAZU, and Naritoki MATSUDAIRA, are famous as devotees of Taka-gari and especially the books which Naritoki MATSUDAIRA collected for research are housed in Tokyo National Museum, Shimane prefectural library, etc.

Among daimyo (Japanese territorial lords) Shigemura DATE, Shigehide SHIMAZU, and Naritoki MATSUDAIRA, are famous as devotees of Taka-gari and especially the books which Naritoki MATSUDAIRA collected for research are housed in Tokyo National Museum, Shimane prefectural library, etc.

sen.j: 明治維新後、鷹狩は大名特権から自由化され、明治25年の「狩猟規則」及び明治28年の「狩猟法」で9年間免許制の下に置かれたが、明治34年の改正「狩猟法」以後、狩猟対象鳥獣種・数と狩猟期間・場所の一般規制のみを受ける自由猟法として今日に至る。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, Taka-gari was liberalized from the privilege of daimyo and was under control of licensing system for nine years by 'Shuryo-kisoku (game law)' in 1892 and 'Shuryo-ho (Game Act)' in 1895, and after a revision of 'Shuryo-ho' 1901, Taka-gari has been liberalized except kinds and numbers of birds for hunting and time and places for it.

After Meiji Restoration, Taka-gari was liberalized from the privilege of daimyo and came under control of a licensing system for nine years by 'Shuryo-kisoku (game law)' in 1892 and 'Shuryo-ho (Game Act)' in 1895, and after a revision of 'Shuryo-ho' 1901, Taka-gari has been liberalized except for the kinds and numbers of birds for hunting and the time and place for it.

After Meiji Restoration, Taka-gari was liberalized from the privilege of daimyo and came under control of a licensing system for nine years by 'Shuryo-kisoku (game law)' in 1892 and 'Shuryo-ho (Game Act)' in 1895, and after a revision of 'Shuryo-ho' 1901, Taka-gari has been liberalized except for the kinds and numbers of birds for hunting and the time and place for it.

sen.j: 明治天皇の意により、宮内省式部職の下で鷹匠の雇用・育成も図られたが、第二次世界大戦後、宮内庁による実猟は中断している。
sen.e: In accordance with the will of Emperor Meiji, Takajo was employed and cultivated under Shikibu-shoku, Imperial Household Ministry, but actual hunting by Imperial Household Agency has been interrupted after the World War II.

In accordance with the will of Emperor Meiji, Takajo was employed and cultivated under the Shikibu-shoku, Imperial Household Ministry, but the actual hunting by the Imperial Household Agency was interrupted after the World War II.

In accordance with the will of Emperor Meiji, Takajo was employed and cultivated under the Shikibu-shoku (Imperial Household Ministry) but the actual hunting by the Imperial Household Agency was interrupted after the World War II.

sen.j: 幕府・宮内省鷹匠の技術は、村越仙太郎（1857?-1937）・花見薫（1910-2002）ら、退職した宮内省/宮内庁鷹匠により民間有志に伝えられ、現在活動している鷹狩従事者（松原英俊を除く）は、特定流派名を名乗るか否かに関わらず、そのいずれかの技術的系譜を引く。
sen.e: The technique of Takajo of Shogunate and Imperial Household Ministry was transmitted to private volunteers by Takajo such as Sentaro MURAKOSHI (c.1857-1937) and Kaoru HANAMI (1910-2002), who retired Imperial Household Ministry or Imperial House hold Agency, so that the people who perform Taka-gari at present (except Hidetoshi MATSUBARA) succeed either technique of them without regard to their identifying a specific school or not.

The technique of Takajo of the Shogunate and Imperial Household Ministry was tranferred to private volunteers by Takajo such as Sentaro MURAKOSHI (c.1857-1937) and Kaoru HANAMI (1910-2002), who retired from the Imperial Household Ministry or Imperial Household Agency, so those who practice Taka-gari at present (except for Hidetoshi MATSUBARA) succeed either technique whether they identify with a specific school or not.

The technique of Takajo of the Shogunate and Imperial Household Ministry was tranferred to private volunteers by Takajo such as Sentaro MURAKOSHI (c.1857-1937) and Kaoru HANAMI (1910-2002), who retired from the Imperial Household Ministry or Imperial Household Agency, so those who practice Taka-gari at present (except for Hidetoshi MATSUBARA) succeed either technique whether they identify with a specific school or not.

sen.j: 早期の民間団体としては、中西悟堂も発起人に名を連ねた日本放鷹倶楽部（1936）があったが中断した。
sen.e: As an early private association, Nihon Hoyo Club (Japan falconry Club), of which Godo NAKANISHI was a promoter, was established in 1936 but it was interrupted.
As an early private association, the Nihon Hoyo Club (Japan falconry Club), promoted by Godo NAKANISHI was established in 1936, but it was interrupted.
As an early private association, the Nihon Hoyo Club (Japan falconry Club), promoted by Godo NAKANISHI was established in 1936, but it was interrupted.

sen.j: 村越仙太郎に師事した丹羽有得（1901-1993）の門下からは日本鷹狩文化保存会、森覚之丞研究会、吉田流鷹狩協会など、花見薫の門下からは日本放鷹協会、諏訪流放鷹術保存会などが結成されている。
sen.e: Descendants of Yutoku NIWA (丹羽有得) (1901-1993) who learned from Sentaro MURAKOSHI, established associations such as Nihon Takagari-bunka Hozonkai (Japan falconry preservation society), study group of Kakunojo MORI and Yoshida-ryu Takagari Association, while descendants of Kaoru HANAMI established associations such as Nihon Hoyo Kyokai (Japan falconry association) and SUWA Falconry Preservation Society.

Descendants of Yutoku NIWA (丹羽有得) (1901-1993) who learned from Sentaro MURAKOSHI, established associations such as Nihon Takagari-bunka Hozonkai (Japan falconry preservation society), study group of Kakunojo MORI and Yoshida-ryu Takagari Association, while descendants of Kaoru HANAMI established associations such as the Nihon Hoyo Kyokai (Japan falconry association) and the SUWA Falconry Preservation Society.

Descendants of Yutoku NIWA (丹羽有得) (1901-1993) who learned from Sentaro MURAKOSHI, established associations such as Nihon Takagari-bunka Hozonkai (Japan falconry preservation society), study group of Kakunojo MORI and Yoshida school Takagari Association, while descendants of Kaoru HANAMI established associations such as the Nihon Hoyo Kyokai (Japan falconry association) and the SUWA Falconry Preservation Society.

sen.j: 大原総一郎が丹羽有得を招聘して設立した日本鷹狩クラブは、その早世後、ある時期に鷹狩の伝統の保存・公開普及という目的から外れ、改組・改名されたらしい。
sen.e: Nihon Takagari Club (Japan falconry club), which Soichiro OHARA established bringing Yutoku NIWA, seems to be reorganized and renamed after his death in early life, changing its aim from preservation, publication and diffusion of Taka-gari tradition at some stage.

Nihon Takagari Club (Japan falconry club), which Soichiro OHARA established bringing Yutoku NIWA, seems to have been reorganized and renamed after his death in early life, changing its purpose from preservation, publication, and diffusion of Taka-gari tradition.

Nihon Takagari Club (Japan falconry club), which Soichiro OHARA established bringing Yutoku NIWA, seems to have been reorganized and renamed after his death in early life, changing its purpose from preservation, publication, and diffusion of Taka-gari tradition.

sen.j: 現在同一地所にある日本ワシタカ研究センターなる施設は公開されておらず、組織・活動実態と財産状況は不明であるが、年間予算2200万円とされ、所用の封筒には中部電力総務部が本部事務局として表記されている。
sen.e: At present, a facility named The Japan Falconiformes Center located at the same place is not open to public and the actual conditions of its organization, activity, and finance are not known, but it is said to have 22 million annual budget and its envelop mentions that its head office locates in General Affairs Department of Chubu Electric Power Company.

At present, a facility named The Japan Falconiformes Center located at the same place is not open to the public and the actual conditions of its organization, activity, and finance are not known, but it is said to have 22 million annual budget and its envelop mentions that its head office is located in the General Affairs Department of Chubu Electric Power Company.

At present, a facility named The Japan Falconiformes Center located at the same place is not open to the public and the actual conditions of its organization, activity, and finance are not known, but it is said to have 22 million annual budget and its envelop mentions that its head office is located in the General Affairs Department of Chubu Electric Power Company.

sen.j: 一方、明治以降、東北地方において、当初士族層・一定の資力のある農民・マタギの間でクマタカによる雪山の鷹狩が広がりを見せた。
sen.e: On the other hand, after Meiji Period in Tohoku Region, Taka-gari in snowcapped mountain by hawk eagle had spread among warrior demographic, rich farmers and Matagi hunter group at an early stage.

However, after Meiji Period in the Tohoku Region, Taka-gari in the snowcapped mountains using mountain hawk eagle had spread among the warrior class, rich farmer, and Matagi hunter groups, at an early stage.
sen.cmt: the term "hawk eagle" does not seem to be correct, a "hawk" and an "eagle" are separate species of birds so, there is no such thing as a "hawk eagle" So, this raises the question is the translator talking about a "hawk" or an "eagle" or both? This needs to be clarified"mountain hawk eagle" としました。
sen.e: However, after Meiji Period in the Tohoku Region, Taka-gari in the snowcapped mountains using mountain hawk-eagle had spread among the warrior class, rich farmer, and Matagi hunter groups, at an early stage.
sen.cmt: スペース削除"mountain hawk eagle"→mountain hawk-eagleとしました。他に「Hodgson's hawk-eagle」の表記もあります。http://www.biodic.go.jp/J-IBIS.htmlhttp://www.sizenken.biodic.go.jp/mokin/a14.html

sen.j: クマタカの飼育自体は鎌倉時代から見られ（古今著聞集）、中世の鷹書においても「角鷹」への言及が見られる。
sen.e: Feeding of hawk eagle itself has been seen since Kamakura Period (Kokon-Chomonju (Collection of Folk-Literature)), and in the book on falconry in medieval times there is a description about 'Kumataka Mountain Hawk-eagle.'

Feeding of mountain hawk eagle itself has been seen since Kamakura Period (Kokon-Chomonju (Collection of Folk-Literature)), and in the book on falconry in medieval times there is a description about the 'Kumataka Mountain Hawk-eagle.'

Feeding of mountain hawk-eagle itself has been seen since Kamakura Period (Kokon-Chomonju (Collection of Folk-Literature)), and in the book on falconry in medieval times there is a description about the 'Kumataka (Mountain hawk-eagle).'
sen.cmt: 「角鷹」は「熊鷹」「クマタカ」と同意です。()補足

sen.j: 東北地方の「鷹使い」の起源は明らかでなく、幕末以前に遡る見方もあるが、用具とその名称に共通・類似するものがあることから、武士の鷹狩が土着化したものと見られる。
sen.e: The origin of 'hawker' in Tohoku Region is not clear, although some people guess that it started before Meiji Period, and it seems that Taka-gari of warriors was indigenized to it because both have common or similar tools and names.

The origin of 'hawker' in the Tohoku Region is not clear, although some people guess that it started before the Meiji Period, and it seems that Taka-gari practiced by warriors was indigenized because both have common or similar equipment and names.

The origin of 'hawker' in the Tohoku Region is not clear, although some people guess that it started before the Meiji Period, and it seems that Taka-gari practiced by warriors was indigenized because both have common or similar equipment and names.

sen.j: 名手として知られた三浦恒吉(1863-1938)は、院内の伝助なる人物の流れを汲むが、旧新庄藩鷹匠家の佐々木甚助とも親交があった。
sen.e: A past master, Tsunekichi MIURA (三浦恒吉) (1863-1938), who was descended form of a person, Densuke (伝助) of Innai, also communicated with Jinsuke SASAKI of Takajo family, domain of former Shinjo.
A past master, Tsunekichi MIURA (三浦恒吉) (1863-1938), who was descended from Densuke (伝助) of Innai, also communicated with Jinsuke SASAKI of the Takajo family, the domain of the former Shinjo.
A past master, Tsunekichi MIURA (三浦恒吉) (1863-1938), who was descended from Densuke (伝助) of Innai, also communicated with Jinsuke SASAKI of the Takajo family, the domain of the former Shinjo.

sen.j: 東北地方の「鷹使い」は生業鷹匠として発展したが、第二次世界大戦後の経済状況の変化で急速に衰亡し、現在では沓澤朝治(1896-1983)の下で1年間学んだ松原英俊1人が残っているにすぎない。
sen.e: The 'hawker' in Tohoku Region developed as Takajo of regular vocation, but declined rapidly because of the change of economic situation after the World War II, so that only Hidetoshi MATSUBARA, who learned from Asaji KUTSUZAWA (1896-1983) for a year, remains as a hawker at present.

The 'hawker' in the Tohoku Region developed as Takajo of a regular vocation, but declined rapidly because of the change in the economy after the World War II, so only Hidetoshi MATSUBARA, who learned from Asaji KUTSUZAWA (1896-1983) for a year, remains as a present day hawker.

The 'hawker' in the Tohoku Region developed as Takajo of a regular vocation, but declined rapidly because of the change in the economy after the World War II, so only Hidetoshi MATSUBARA, who learned from Asaji KUTSUZAWA (1896-1983) for a year, remains as a present day hawker.
